page.title: 09O.S. Area 4344-3940
page.content: This area is a mixture of farmland and woodland, with the A1 trunk road crossing it North to South. The woodland covers the East section and is a mixture of deciduous and coniferous trees. The wood is owned by the Forestry Commission and a public footpath runs down the East inside of the wood. In the South West section is Nuthill Farm owned by Mr. and Mrs. Gill. This consists of a farmhouse, 2 barns, an out building and 14 large sheds containing geese. In the North West is a detached house belonging to Mr. and Mrs. K. Lovat-Fraser. In the extreme South there are 2 service stations and Little Chefs either side of the A1. There is also row of (3) terraced houses. From the North East tip to Nuthill Farm there is visible a ridge which was a Roman road.
